definition: not to mince words/not to beat about the bush
pinyin: da3 kai1 tian1 chuang1 shuo1 liang4 hua4

definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: But the librarian, who believed in calling a spade a spade , rebutted those he stole the books.
sentences.chinese: 管制員卻打開天窗說亮話，反駁他其實是想偷書。

sentences.english: But the librarian, who believed in calling a spade a spade , rebutted that he stole the books.
sentences.chinese: 但是管理員卻打開天窗說亮話，反駁他其實是想偷書。
是時候打開天窗說亮話了。

sentences.english: Let's get everything out in the open.
I'm being open with you about this.
sentences.chinese: 我是跟你打開天窗說亮話。

sentences.english: But the librarian, who believed in calling a spade a spade, rebutted that he stole the books.
sentences.chinese: 然而管理員卻打開天窗說亮話，辯駁他實在是想偷書。
